intro: Byttneria inodora, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a tropical tree native to regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers followed by woody, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. It is often found in moist, fertile soils and can grow up to 20 meters in height. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
